title.narrative: (Solidarités) Integrated assistance to the vulnerable populations in two areas of Myanmar: Dry Zone and Chin State

description.narrative:
This project aims at improving the living conditions of vulnerable populations in Myanmar, through an integrated approach tackling water access, hygiene and livelihoods in Dry Zone and Chin State. The intervention areas include three townships in Dry Zone: Monywa, Yinmabin and Yesagyo, and Kanpetlet Township in Chin State.
Specific objective: To support the access to water, health and livelihoods of populations affected by extreme weather conditions (Dry Zone) and rural isolation (Southern Chin State).
Component 1: Increase of access to water and improvement of livelihoods of populations affected by extreme weather conditions in Dry Zone Outputs: 1.Increase of accessibility of improved water resources 2.Increase capacity of targeted households to protect themselves and families from diarrhoeal disease 3.Community members can develop the capacity to construct or maintain infrastructure independently and diversify their sources of income
Component 2: Improvement of livelihoods and enhancing self-reliance among populations affected by rural isolation in Southern Chin State Outputs: 1.Targeted households improve livelihoods through adapted support to farming activities 2.Targeted households increase their diversity of diet through the continuation or creation of Compound Vegetable Farms (CVFs) 3.Improvement of farming techniques of targeted households 4.Improvement and diversification of livelihoods of targeted households in the short and long terms
